hero.title: About the foundation
hero.intro: The Dogecoin Foundation is a not-for-profit organisation established to provide:
bulletPoints: Support for the Dogecoin crypto-currency through development and advocacy.
Dogecoin trademark defense to prevent abuse and fraud.
A trailmap for the future of Dogecoin.
hero.subtitleAfter: - the accidental crypto movement that makes people smile.

manifesto.title: The Dogecoin Manifesto
manifesto.intro: We are developing a currency for the people, and we strive to do only good everyday. Through this work we have come to value:

cards.title: Being useful
cards.text: We value utility over technical brilliance.

cards.title: Being personable
cards.text: We value individuals and interactions over profit-driven economics.

cards.title: Being welcoming
cards.text: We value collaboration and trust over competition and exclusivity.

cards.title: Being reliable
cards.text: We value working solutions over speed of delivery.

sign.title: Sign the manifesto
sign.text: You can sign the Dogecoin Manifesto on X

history.title: Our history
history.description: The Foundation was established by Dogecoin team members in 2014 to support and advocate for the project. Created in December 2013 by Billy Markus and Jackson Palmer as a fun alternative to Bitcoin, Dogecoin was inspired by the "Doge" meme and quickly gained a strong community known for charitable efforts, such as funding the Jamaican bobsled team and Doge4Water. As interest fluctuated, the Foundation became less active but was revived in 2021 by original team members, new faces, and advisors like Ethereum’s Vitalik Buterin and Neuralink’s Jared Birchall. The revival aimed to secure funding, provide strategic direction, and ensure Dogecoin’s long-term growth.

meta.title: Dogecoin Foundation - Do Only Good Everyday
meta.description: The official website of the Dogecoin Foundation. Learn about our projects, community initiatives, and how to support the Dogecoin ecosystem.

gigawallet.title: #GigaWallet
gigawallet.subtitle: Open source project
gigawallet.text:
Dogecoin GigaWallet is a backend service which provides a convenient integration API for platforms such as online shops, exchanges, social media platforms etc, to accept and transact Dogecoin on behalf of their users.

The purpose of the GigaWallet is to promote the rapid uptake of Dogecoin as a payment option, by taking the complexity and risk out of integrating Dogecoin payments into business.

core.title: #Dogecoin Core
core.subtitle: Open source project
core.text:
The Dogecoin Core software allows anyone to operate a node in the Dogecoin blockchain networks and uses the Scrypt hashing method for Proof of Work. It is adapted from Bitcoin Core and other cryptocurrencies.

We contribute to the Dogecoin Core open source project via development, evangelism and education - and encourage you to as well.

teamseas.title: #TeamSeas
teamseas.subtitle: Charitable
teamseas.text: The Dogecoin Foundation and community collaborated with MrBeast in 2021 on the #TeamSeas campaign (also known as CleanSeas). The initiative aimed to remove trash from oceans, rivers, and beaches.
keyPoints: The goal was to raise funds to help remove 30 million pounds of trash from oceans
Each $1 donated removed 1 pound of trash
The Dogecoin community participated by donating DOGE
The campaign partnered with Ocean Conservancy and The Ocean Cleanup

kabosu.title: #Kabosu Statue
kabosu.subtitle: Fun!
kabosu.text: The Dogecoin Foundation helped fund the permanent bronze statue of the Kabosu Shiba Inu (the original "doge" from the meme) in Sakura, Japan. This initiative took place in 2023.
keyPoints: Kabosu is the real Shiba Inu dog from the original meme that inspired Dogecoin
The statue was placed in Sakura City, Japan (where Kabosu lives)
The project was a collaboration between the local government, the Dogecoin community, and Kabosu's owner Atsuko Sato
It was funded through community donations

mission.title: Such Mission
mission.description: Our mission is to promote the development and adoption of Dogecoin as a fun, accessible, and inclusive cryptocurrency.

cards.title: Accessibility
cards.description: Make cryptocurrency accessible to everyone, regardless of technical background or financial status.

cards.title: Community
cards.description: Build and nurture a strong, inclusive community that supports each other and spreads kindness.

cards.title: Innovation
cards.description: Drive innovation in blockchain technology while maintaining simplicity and usability.

cards.title: Education
cards.description: Provide educational resources to help people understand and safely use cryptocurrency.

cards.title: Charity
cards.description: Support charitable causes and community initiatives that make the world a better place.

cards.title: Transparency
cards.description: Maintain transparency in all our operations and decision-making processes.

cards.title: Sustainability
cards.description: Ensure the long-term sustainability and growth of the Dogecoin ecosystem.

cards.title: Fun
cards.description: Keep the fun and lighthearted spirit that makes Dogecoin unique and enjoyable.

development.title: Development
development.text: Help fund ongoing development and maintenance of the Dogecoin network infrastructure.

community.title: Community Projects
community.text: Contribute to charitable initiatives and community-driven projects that spread kindness.

education.title: Educational Resources
education.text: Support educational content and resources to help people learn about cryptocurrency.

houseOfDoge.name: House of Doge
houseOfDoge.description: Official corporate partners of the Dogecoin Foundation, committed to transforming Dogecoin into a fully integrated and accessible global payment platform and currency. Their mission is to advance the mainstream adoption of Dogecoin by enhancing its utility through real-world application.

footer.description: The Shiba Inu is a Japanese breed of dog that was popularized as an online meme and represents Dogecoin. Dogecoin was created by Jackson Palmer & Shibetoshi Nakamoto.
